title: CONVERSION: Paywall Boundaries
description: FREE: 5 active jobs, 3 customers, basic invoicing, online payments. PAID ($49/mo): Unlimited jobs, unlimited customers, 1 helper account, priority support badge. No feature-gating on core workflow - only volume limits.

description: Mayor's daemon patrol loop for handling callbacks, health checks, and cleanup.

description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Calendar view, create/edit jobs, assign to date/time/customer. AC: View calendar, create job, job shows on calendar.

title: CONVERSION: Pricing Page
description: Two tiers only. FREE: 5 jobs, 3 customers, $0 forever. PRO: Unlimited everything + 1 helper, $49/mo flat. No annual discount (keeps it simple). FAQ: 'What counts as active job?' 'Can I downgrade?' 'What payment methods?'

title: CORE: Job Status Tracking
description: Job status workflow: Scheduled → In Progress → Complete. AC: Status badge, click to change, persists to DB.

title: ReleaseNoteBot MVP
description: Micro-SaaS that generates weekly release note digests from GitHub repos. Users connect GitHub, pick repos, get weekly email summaries of merged PRs/commits. Free tier: 1 repo, 1 recipient. Pro tier: 10 repos, 10 recipients, GitHub Issue posting.
close_reason: ReleaseNoteBot MVP complete. All 24 subtasks done: PRD, architecture, scaffold, auth, repo selection, digest generation, email, Stripe, weekly job, demo mode, tests, docs, and README.

title: PRD: ReleaseNoteBot
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Write comprehensive PRD for ReleaseNoteBot MVP
acceptance_criteria:
- Problem statement defined
- Target user personas identified
- MVP scope with explicit non-goals
- Pricing tiers documented (Free/Pro)
- Success metrics defined
- File at /releasenotebot/docs/PRD.md

title: Demo Mode
description: Public demo endpoint for conversion
acceptance_criteria:
- Endpoint /demo page
- User pastes public repo URL
- Shows sample digest preview (no auth required)
- Rate limited (10/hour per IP)
- CTA to sign up
- Works for public repos only

title: Unit and Integration Tests
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Test coverage for core functionality
acceptance_criteria:
- Unit tests for digest generation (mocked GitHub data)
- Unit tests for categorization logic
- Integration test for weekly job (mocked email/GitHub)
- Test file structure mirrors source
- npm test runs all tests
- CI-ready
close_reason: 104 tests passing: billing (22), stripe (11), digest (29), github (15), email (12), cron (15)

title: Deployment Documentation
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Write deployment guide for single platform
acceptance_criteria:
- Pick one platform (Railway)
- Step-by-step deployment instructions
- Environment variables list with descriptions
- Database setup instructions
- Cron/scheduler setup for weekly job
- File at /releasenotebot/docs/DEPLOYMENT.md

title: README
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Write project README
acceptance_criteria:
- What it is (1-2 sentences)
- How it works (brief overview)
- Local dev instructions (setup, run, test)
- Environment variables needed
- How subscriptions work (Stripe test mode)
- File at /releasenotebot/README.md

title: Scaffold Next.js App
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Initialize Next.js project with TypeScript, Prisma, Postgres
acceptance_criteria:
- Next.js 14+ with App Router
- TypeScript configured
- Prisma initialized with Postgres
- Tailwind CSS for styling
- Basic project structure in /releasenotebot
- package.json with scripts: dev, build, start, db:push

title: NextAuth + GitHub OAuth
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Implement authentication with NextAuth and GitHub OAuth
acceptance_criteria:
- NextAuth configured with GitHub provider
- OAuth scopes: read:user, repo (for private repos)
- User model in Prisma with GitHub token encrypted
- Login/logout pages functional
- Session middleware protecting routes
- Environment variables documented

title: Repo Selection UI
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Build repo selection and settings interface
acceptance_criteria:
- Page to list user's GitHub repos (from API)
- Checkbox to subscribe to repos (limit enforced by tier)
- Settings per subscription: cadence (weekly), recipients, timezone
- Save to database
- Show current subscriptions with edit/delete

title: Digest Generation Logic
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Core algorithm to generate release note digests from GitHub data
acceptance_criteria:
- Fetch merged PRs (or commits) since last_run_at
- Categorize into sections: Highlights, Fixes, Docs/Chores
- Highlights: top 3 by labels/files changed/important flag
- Each item: title + link + 1-sentence summary
- Handle edge cases: no PRs, rate limiting, pagination
- Unit tests with mocked GitHub data

title: Email Sending
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Email delivery for digests using Resend
acceptance_criteria:
- Resend integration for email delivery
- Email template for digest (clean HTML)
- Send to all recipients for subscription
- Local dev uses console sink
- Handle delivery failures gracefully
- Test with mock provider

title: Stripe Subscriptions
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Integrate Stripe for subscription billing
acceptance_criteria:
- Stripe SDK integration
- Two products: Free (default), Pro (7/mo)
- Checkout flow for upgrading to Pro
- Webhook handling for subscription events
- User model tracks stripe_customer_id, subscription_status
- Feature gating based on tier (repo/recipient limits)
- Test mode works out of box

title: Weekly Job Runner
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Background job to run weekly digests
acceptance_criteria:
- Cron-compatible job that runs weekly
- Fetches all active subscriptions
- Generates and sends digest for each
- Updates last_run_at per subscription
- Handles failures per-subscription
- Can be triggered manually for testing
- Integration test with mocked providers
